adj	suffered or done by one person as a substitute for another

defs: disposed to seek revenge : vengeful
intended for or involving revenge
intended to cause anguish or hurt : spiteful
examples: Though the other girl had only lightly poked fun of Vanessa's choice in attire, Vanessa was so vindictive that she waited for an entire semester to get the perfect revenge.
wordNetDef: adj	disposed to seek revenge or intended for revenge
adj	showing malicious ill will and a desire to hurt; motivated by spite

defs: a loud overbearing woman : termagant
a woman of great stature, strength, and courage
wordNetDef: n	a noisy or scolding or domineering woman
n	a large strong and aggressive woman
examples: Poor Billy was the victim of the virago's invective--she railed at him for a good 30-minutes about how he is the scum of the earth for speaking loudly on his cellphone in public.

defs: not present or in evidence : absent
not being up to standards or expectations
lacking in ability or capacity : deficient
examples: She did not think her vocabulary was wanting, yet there were so many words that inevitably she found a few she didn't know.
